key_title: Key to the species of Bulbine

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Xanthorrhoeaceae

source.author: Conran, J.G.; Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Bulbine
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G.; Walsh, N.G. (1994). Bulbine. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Perianth segments less than 7 mm long; plants annual; leaves flat to subterete
Perianth segments more than 7 mm long; plants perennial; leaves channelled, subterete or terete
Seeds winged; capsule 4–9 mm long; all staminal filaments hairy below anther
Seeds not winged; capsule 2–5 mm long; inner 3 stamens bearded
Mature leaves somewhat flaccid, hollow, pale to dark green; stamens bunched, anthers partially obscured by acute or clavate filament hairs; generally with tuberous rootstock
Mature leaves not flaccid, glaucous or grey-green; stamens grouped or spreading, anthers not obscured by hairs on filaments; rootstock not tuberous
Scapes 2–6 mm diam.; all stamens bearded; leaves glaucous
Plants robust, scapes 7–10 mm diam.; inner stamens bearded, outer stamens glabrous or sparsely hairy; leaves generally not glaucous
